metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15671 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
The glob function in glob.c in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.27, when invoked with GLOB_TILDE, could skip freeing allocated memory when processing the ~ operator with a long user name, potentially leading to a denial of service (memory leak).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-15671` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.27-3ubuntu1
libc-bin - 2.27-3ubuntu1
libc6 - 2.27-3ubuntu1
libc6-amd64 - 2.27-3ubuntu1
libc6-i386 - 2.27-3ubuntu1
libc6-prof - 2.27-3ubuntu1
libc6-s390 - 2.27-3ubuntu1
libc6-x32 - 2.27-3ubuntu1
locales - 2.27-3ubuntu1
locales-all - 2.27-3ubuntu1
nscd - 2.27-3ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glibc package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.27-3ubuntu1').
